steps.title: Do you want to stay updated on everything Umbraco?
steps.content:
Thank you for using Umbraco! Would you like to stay up-to-date with Umbraco product updates, security advisories, community news and special offers? Sign up for our newsletter and never miss out on the latest Umbraco news.

By signing up, you agree that we can use your info according to our privacy policy.

steps.title: Thank you for subscribing to our mailing list
Welcome to Umbraco - The Friendly CMS
steps.content:
Thank you for choosing Umbraco - we think this could be the beginning of something beautiful. While it may feel overwhelming at first, we've done a lot to make the learning curve as smooth and fast as possible.

In this quick tour we will introduce you to the main areas of Umbraco and show you how to best get started.

If you don't want to take the tour now you can always start it by opening the Help drawer in the top right corner.

steps.title: Main Menu
steps.content: This is the main menu in Umbraco backoffice. Here you can navigate between the different sections, search for items, see your user profile and open the help drawer.

steps.title: Sections
steps.content: Each area in Umbraco is called a Section. Right now you are in the Content section, when you want to go to another section simply click on the appropriate name in the main menu and you'll be there in no time.

steps.title: The Tree
steps.content:
This is the Tree and it is the main navigation inside a section.

In the Content section the tree is called the Content tree and here you can navigate the content of your website.

steps.title: Dashboards
steps.content:
A dashboard is the main view you are presented with when entering a section within the backoffice, and can be used to show valuable information to the users of the system.

Notice that some sections have multiple dashboards.

steps.title: Search
steps.content: The search allows you to quickly find whatever you're looking for across sections within Umbraco.

steps.title: User profile
steps.content: Now click on your user avatar to open the user profile dialog.

steps.title: User profile
steps.content:
Here you can see details about your user, change your password and log out of Umbraco.

In the User section you will be able to do more advanced user management.

steps.title: User profile
steps.content: Let's close the user profile again.

steps.title: Help
steps.content: If you ever find yourself in trouble click here to open the Help drawer.

steps.title: Help
steps.content:
In the help drawer you will find articles and videos related to the section you are using.

This is also where you will find the next tour on how to get started with Umbraco.

steps.title: Tours
steps.content: To continue your journey on getting started with Umbraco, you can find more tours right here.

steps.title: Create your first Document Type
steps.content:
Step 1 of any site is to create a Document Type.
A Document Type is a template for content. For each type of content you want to create you'll create a Document Type. This will define where content based on this Document Type can be created, how many properties it holds and what the input method should be for these properties.

When you have at least one Document Type in place you can start creating content and this content can then be used in a template.

In this tour you will learn how to set up a basic Document Type with a property to enter a short text.

steps.title: Navigate to the Settings sections
steps.content: In the Settings section you can create and manage Document types.

steps.title: Create Document Type
steps.content: Hover over the Document Type tree and click the three small dots to open the context menu.

steps.title: Create Document Type
steps.content:
Click Document Type to create a new document type with a template. The template will be automatically created and set as the default template for this Document Type.

You will use the template in a later tour to render content.

steps.title: Enter a name
steps.content: Your Document Type needs a name. Enter Home Page in the field and click Next.

steps.title: Enter a description
steps.content:
A description helps to pick the right document type when creating content.

Write a description for our Home page. It could be: 

The home page of the website

steps.title: Properties, groups, and tabs
steps.content: A Document Type consist of Properties (data fields/attributes) where an editor can input data. For complex Document Types you can organize Properties in groups and tabs.

steps.title: Add group
steps.content: In this tour we only need a group. Click Add Group to add a group.

steps.title: Name the group
steps.content:
Enter Home in the group name.

You can name a group anything you want and if you have a lot of properties it can be useful to add multiple groups.

steps.title: Add a property
steps.content:
Properties are the different input fields on a content page.

On our Home Page we want to add a welcome text.

Click Add property to open the property dialog.

steps.title: Name the property
steps.content: Enter Welcome Text as the name for the property.

steps.title: Enter a description
steps.content:
A description will help your editor fill in the right content.

Enter a description for the property editor. It could be:

Write a nice introduction text so the visitors feel welcome

steps.title: Add editor
steps.content: When you add an editor you choose what the input method for this property will be. Click Add editor to open the editor picker dialog.

steps.title: Editor picker
steps.content: In the editor picker dialog we can pick one of the many built-in editors.

steps.title: Select editor
steps.content: Select the Textarea editor. This will add a textarea to the Welcome Text property.

steps.title: Editor settings
steps.content: Each property editor can have individual settings. For the textarea editor you can set a character limit but in this case it is not needed.

steps.title: Add property to document type
steps.content: Click Submit to add the property to the document type.

steps.title: Check the document type permissions
steps.content: Click Permissions to view the permissions page.

steps.title: Allow this document type to work at the root of your site
steps.content: Toggle the switch Allow as root to allow new content pages based on this document type to be created at the root of your site

steps.title: Save the document type
steps.content: All we need now is to save the document type. Click Save to create and save your new document type.

steps.title: Creating your first content node
steps.content: In this tour you will learn how to create the home page for your website. It will use the Home Page Document type you created in the previous tour.

steps.title: Navigate to the Content section
steps.content:
In the Content section you can create and manage the content of the website.

The Content section contains the content of your website. Content is displayed as nodes in the content tree.

steps.title: Open context menu
steps.content:
Open the context menu by hovering over the root of the content section.

Now click the three small dots to the right.

steps.title: Create Home page
steps.content:
The context menu shows you all the actions that are available on a node

Click on Home Page to create a new page of type Home Page.

steps.title: Give your new page a name
steps.content: Our new page needs a name. Enter Home in the field and click Next.

steps.title: Add a welcome text
steps.content:
Add content to the Welcome Text field.

If you don't have any ideas here is a start:

I am learning Umbraco. High Five I Rock #H5IR

steps.title: Publish
steps.content: Now click the Publish button to publish your changes.

steps.title: Render your content in a template
steps.content:
Templating in Umbraco builds on the concept of Razor Views from ASP.NET MVC. This tour is a sneak peak on how to write templates in Umbraco.

In this tour you will learn how to render content from the Home Page document type so you can see the content added to our Home content page.

steps.title: Navigate to the Settings section
steps.content:
In the Settings section you will find all the templates.

It is of course also possible to edit all your code files in your favorite code editor.

steps.title: Expand the Templates node
steps.content: To see all our templates click the small triangle to the left of the templates node.

steps.title: Open Home template
steps.content: Click the Home Page template to open and edit it.

steps.title: Edit template
steps.content:
The template can be edited here or in your favorite code editor.

To render the field from the document type add the following to the template:

<h1>@Model.Name</h1>
<p>@Model.WelcomeText</p>

steps.title: Save the template
steps.content: Click the Save button and your template will be saved.

steps.title: View your Umbraco site
steps.content:
Our three main components for a page are done: Document type, Template, and Content. It is now time to see the result.

In this tour you will learn how to see your published website.

steps.title: Navigate to the content sections
steps.content: In the Content section you will find the content of our website.

steps.title: Open the Home page
steps.content: Click the Home page to open it.

steps.title: Info
steps.content: Under the Info-app you will find the default information about a content item.

steps.title: Open page
steps.content:
Click the Link to document to view your page.

Tip: Click the preview button in the bottom right corner to preview changes without publishing them.

steps.title: How to use the media library
steps.content:
A website would be boring without media content. In Umbraco you can manage all your images, documents, videos etc. in the Media section. Here you can upload and organise your media items and see details about each item.

In this tour you will learn how to upload and organise your Media library in Umbraco. It will also show you how to view details about a specific media item.

steps.title: Navigate to the Media section
steps.content: The media section is where you manage all your media items.

steps.title: Create a new folder
steps.content: First create a folder for your images. Hover over the media root node and click the three small dots on the right side of the item.

steps.title: Create a new folder
steps.content: Select the Folder option to select the type folder.

steps.title: Enter a name
steps.content: Enter My Images in the field.

steps.title: Save the folder
steps.content: Click the Save button to create the new folder.

steps.title: Upload images
steps.content:
In the upload area you can upload your media items.

Click the Click here to choose files button and select a couple of images on your computer and upload them.

steps.title: View media item details
steps.content: Hover over the media item and Click the white bar to view details about the media item.

steps.title: The uploaded image
steps.content: Here you can see the image you have uploaded.

steps.title: Image size
steps.content:
You will also find other details about the image, like the size.

Media items work in much the same way as content. So you can add extra properties to an image by creating or editing the Media types in the Settings section.

steps.title: Info
steps.content: Like the content section you can also find default information about the media item. You will find these under the info app.

steps.title: Link to media
steps.content: The path to the media item...

steps.title: Last edited
steps.content: ...and information about when the media item has been created and edited.

steps.title: Using media items
steps.content: You can reference a media item directly in a template by using the path or try adding a Media Picker to a document type property so you can select media items from the content section.
